sen.j: 十五里ヶ原の戦い（じゅうごりがはらのたたかい）は天正16年（1588年）8月、本庄繁長率いる上杉景勝・大宝寺義勝連合軍と東禅寺義長・東禅寺勝正兄弟率いる最上義光軍との戦である。
sen.e: In the Battle of Jugorigahara broke out in August 1588, the allied troops of Kagekatsu UESUGI and Yoshikatsu DAIHOJI led by Shigenaga HONJO fought against Yoshiaki MOGAMI's troops led by Yoshinaga and Katsumasa TOZENJI brothers.

In the Battle of Jugorigahara, which broke out in August 1588, the allied troops of Kagekatsu UESUGI and Yoshikatsu DAIHOJI, led by Shigenaga HONJO, fought against Yoshiaki MOGAMI's troops, which were led by the brothers Yoshinaga and Katsumasa TOZENJI.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: During the Battle of Jugorigahara, which was fought in September and October 1588, the allied troops of Kagekatsu UESUGI and Yoshikatsu DAIHOJI, led by Shigenaga HONJO, fought against Yoshiaki MOGAMI's troops, which were led by the brothers Yoshinaga and Katsumasa TOZENJI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 出羽国庄内地方は大宝寺大宝寺氏が代々支配していた。
sen.e: The Daihoji Muto clan had ruled the Shonai District, Dewa Provinces for generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処Webにより「大宝寺武藤氏」と訂正しました。また庄内地方はwebではregionでしたが後列に奥羽があり，面積の違いをだす必要性を考え以後庄内はdistrict，奥羽をregionで訳しました。
sen.e: The Daihoji Muto clan had ruled the Shonai district of Dewa Province for generations.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Daihoji Muto clan had ruled the Shonai district of Dewa Province for generations.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、戦国時代には相次ぐ家中の内乱に悩まされていた。
sen.e: However, they were annoyed by the successive disturbances within the family during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, they were annoyed by the successive disturbances within the family during the Sengoku (Warring States) period.
sen.cmt: case
sen.e: They were suffered from the successive disturbances within the family during the Warring States period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: またこの地域は庄内平野や酒田市湊を抱えており経済的価値が高く、周囲の上杉氏や最上氏、小野寺氏などが獲得を狙っていた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Shonai district received high economic evaluation for including the Shonai plains and Sakata Minato port, therefore many clans such as Uesugi, Mogami and Onodera watched for an opportunity to plunder this district.
sen.cmt: webを確認し「酒田湊」に訂正しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Shonai district received high economic benefits based on its inclusion of the Shonai plains and Sakata Minato port, so various clans such as Uesugi, Mogami and Onodera watched for an opportunity to plunder this area.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Shonai district received high economic benefits based on its inclusion of the Shonai plains and Sakata Minato port, so various clans including Uesugi, Mogami and Onodera watched for an opportunity to plunder this area.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1580年代、急速に領土を拡大していた山形城主最上義光の攻勢がついに庄内にも及ぶようになると、尾浦城主大宝寺義氏は父・大宝寺義増の代からの盟友本庄繁長の支援を受けてこれに対抗した。
sen.e: When the lord of Yamagata-jo Castle Yoshiaki MOGAMI launched an attack on the Shonai district, who was rapidly expanding his territory, the lord of Oura-jo Castle Yoshiuji DAIHOJI confronted Mogami's troops by receiving support from Shigenaga HONJO, a sworn friend since his father Yoshimasu DAIHOJI's day,.

When the lord of Yamagata-jo Castle, Yoshiaki MOGAMI, who was rapidly expanding his territory, launched an attack on the Shonai district, the lord of Oura-jo Castle, Yoshiuji DAIHOJI, confronted Mogami's troops with the help of Shigenaga HONJO, a sworn friend since the days of his father, Yoshimasu DAIHOJI.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: During the 1580s, when the lord of Yamagatajo Castle, Yoshiaki MOGAMI, who was rapidly expanding his territory, launched an attack on the Shonai district, the lord of Ourajo Castle, Yoshiuji DAIHOJI, confronted Mogami's troops with the help of Shigenaga HONJO, who had been an alliance from the days of his father Yoshimasu DAIHOJI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正11年（1583年）、義光は武藤氏重臣・東禅寺城主東禅寺義長を利用して義氏を暗殺。
sen.e: However, using Yoshinaga TOZENJI, a senior vassal of the Muto clan as well as the lord of Tozenji Castle, Yoshiaki MOGAMI assassinated Yoshiuji DAIHOJI in 1583.
However, in 1583, using Yoshinaga TOZENJI, a senior vassal of the Muto clan and the lord of Tozenji Castle, Yoshiaki MOGAMI assassinated Yoshiuji DAIHOJI.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: In 1583, using Yoshinaga TOZENJI, a senior vassal of the Muto clan and the lord of Tozen-ji Castle, Yoshiaki assassinated Yoshiuji.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正15年（1587年）11月には家督を継いだ弟の大宝寺義興をも攻め殺した。
sen.e: Yoshiaki went on attacking to kill Yoshiuji's younger brother Yoshioki DAIHOJI in 1587 who had succeeded as the head of the family.
Yoshiaki, in continuing his attack, killed Yoshiuji's younger brother and successor as the head of the family, Yoshioki DAIHOJI, in 1587.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Yoshiaki, while continuing his attack, killed Yoshiuji's younger brother and successor as the head of the family, Yoshioki DAIHOJI, during November and December 1587.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 庄内を手に入れた義光は、東禅寺氏にこの地の統治を命じた。
sen.e: After having plundered the Shonai district, Yoshiaki directed the Tozenji clan to rule this district.
Having plundered the Shonai district, Yoshiaki directed the Tozenji clan to rule it.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: When Yoshiaki plundered the Shonai district, he directed the Tozenji clan to rule the district.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この時、義興の養子となっていた本庄繁長の子・大宝寺義勝は実父の下に逃れて捲土重来を誓った。
sen.e: Then, Shigenaga HONJO's son Yoshikatsu DAIHOJI, who had been adopted by Yoshioki DAIHOJI, was determined to resume his power while taking refuge to his biological father
Subsequently, Shigenaga HONJO's son Yoshikatsu DAIHOJI, who had been adopted by Yoshioki DAIHOJI, was determined to resume his power while taking refuge with his biological father.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Subsequently, Shigenaga HONJO's son Yoshikatsu DAIHOJI, who had been adopted by Yoshioki DAIJOJI, was determined to resume his power while taking refuge with his biological father.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これ以後、武藤氏は上杉の完全な影響下に置かれることになる。
sen.e: Since then, the Muto clan had completely been left under the influence of the Uesugi clan.
As a result, the Muto clan was left completely under the influence of the Uesugi clan.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: As a result, the Muto clan was left completely under the influence of the Uesugi clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌天正16年（1588年）1月、最上家の本家にあたり正室の実家でもある大崎氏の内紛に伊達政宗が武力介入すると（大崎合戦）、義光は政宗を討つべく大崎領に援軍を派遣した。
sen.e: When Masamune DATE intervened in a internal disturbance of the Osaki clan by using force in 1588 (which is called "the Battle of Osaki"), Yoshiaki sent reinforcements to Osaki's territory, because the Osaki family was the head house of the Mogami family as well as the family home of Yoshiaki's lawful wife.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When, in 1588, Masamune DATE intervened in an internal disturbance of the Osaki clan by using force (which is called "the Battle of Osaki"), Yoshiaki sent reinforcements to Osaki's territory, because the Osaki family was the head house of the Mogami family as well as the family home of Yoshiaki's lawful wife.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: When Masamune DATE intervened in an internal disturbance of the Osaki clan by using force, which is called the Battle of Osaki in January and February 1588, since the Osaki family was the head house of the Mogami family as well as the family home of Yoshiaki's lawful wife, Yoshiaki sent reinforcements to Osaki's territory.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 同時に伊達領に出兵して各地を攻略した。
sen.e: At the same time, sending troops to Date's territory, Yoshiaki captured some of his territory.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Concurrently, by sending troops to Date's territory, Yoshiaki captured a portion of his territory.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: At the same time, by sending troops to Date's territory, Yoshiaki captured a portion of his territory.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 義光が政宗との戦に忙殺されているのを好機と見た上杉景勝は、庄内占領のため兵を動かした。
sen.e: Regarding the situation that Yoshiaki was busily occupied with the battle against Masamune as a good opportunity, Kagekatsu UESUGI sent troops to conquer the Shonai district.
Taking advantage of the situation in which Yoshiaki was busily occupied with the battle against Masamune, Kagekatsu UESUGI sent troops to conquer the Shonai district.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Kagekatsu UESUGI sent troops to conquer the Shonai district, by taking advantage of the situation in which Yoshiaki was busily occupied with the battle against Masamune.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 8月、上杉景勝は本庄繁長・武藤義勝に尾浦城攻撃を命じる。
sen.e: Kagekatsu UESUGI directed Shigenaga HONJO and Yoshikatsu MUTO to attack Oura-jo Castle in August.
Kagekatsu UESUGI directed Shigenaga HONJO and Yoshikatsu MUTO to attack Oura-jo Castle in August.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kagekatsu UESUGI directed Shigenaga HONJO and Yoshikatsu MUTO to attack Oura-jo Castle in September and October.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一方の東禅寺兄弟は野戦での迎撃を決め、両者は十五里ヶ原で対峙した。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Tozenji brothers decided to meet the enemy in the field, therefore both troops confronted each other at Jugorigahara.
However, the Tozenji brothers decided to meet the enemy in the field, so the troops confronted one another at Jugorigahara.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: On the other hand, the Tozenji brothers decided to meet the enemy in the field; so the troops confronted one another at Jugorigahara.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 合戦開始当初は両軍互角の状況だったが、次第に数で劣る最上軍が追いつめられていった。
sen.e: Although both troops fought a close battle at the beginning, outnumbered Uesugi's allied troops gradually drove Mogami's troops into a corner.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the battle was initially close, Uesugi's allied troops, who outnumbered those of Mogami, gradually drove their opponent into a corner.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Although the battle was initially a pitched battle, the Uesugi's allied troops, who outnumbered those of Mogami, gradually drove their opponent into a corner.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 東禅寺義長は敵本陣に突撃し戦死。
sen.e: Yoshinaga TOZENJI died in the battle after charging the opponent headquarters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshinaga TOZENJI died in the battle after charging the opponent's headquarters.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Yoshinaga TOZENJI charged the opponent's headquarters and died there.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 兄戦死の報を受けた勝正もまた単身本陣へ突入し、不意をついて本庄繁長に斬りかかったが逆に繁長と側近達に討ち取られた。
sen.e: Informed of his brother's death, Katsumasa also charged the headquarters alone and made a surprise attack on Shigenaga HONJO with his sword, however, he was killed by Shigenaga and Shigenaga's close retainers.

Katsumas, having been informed of his brother's death, also charged the headquarters alone and made a surprise attack on Shigenaga HONJO with his sword; however, he was killed by Shigenaga and his close retainers.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: When Katsumasa was informed of his brother's death, he also charged the opponent's headquarters alone and made a surprise attack on Shigenaga HONJO with his sword; but he was killed by Shigenaga and his close retainers.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 勝正の一撃で繁長の兜はこめかみから耳の下まで切り取られたという。
sen.e: Katsumasa's stroke was so heavy that a part of Shigenaga's helmet--from temple to below ear--was cut off.
Katsumasa's stroke was so heavy that a part of Shigenaga's helmet--from the region of the temple to below the ear--was cut off.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Katsumasa's stroke was so heavy that a part of Shigenaga's helmet was cut off from the region of the temple to below the ear
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この時勝正が手にしていたのが名刀正宗で、本庄繁長の手に渡り本荘正宗と言われるようになったという。
sen.e: The sword Katsumasa used at this time was the noted sword "Masamune", which later passed into the hands of Shigenaga HONJO to be renamed "Honjo Masamune" (noted sword "Masamune" owned by Shigenaga HONJO).

The sword Katsumasa used at this time was the noted weapon called "Masamune," which later passed into the hands of Shigenaga HONJO to be renamed "Honjo Masamune" (the noted sword "Masamune" once owned by Shigenaga HONJO).
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: The sword Katsumasa used at this time was the noted Masamune sword, which was later passed into the hands of Shigenaga HONJO to be renamed Honjo Masamune (the noted sword "Masamune" once owned by Shigenaga HONJO).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この後、最上軍は朝日山城などで抵抗を続けたが敗れ、庄内地方は上杉景勝の版図となる。
sen.e: Mogami's troops were defeated despite keeping on resisting at Asahiyama-jo Castle and other places, with the result that the Shonai District was included in the territory of Kagekatsu UESUGI.

Mogami's troops were defeated despite their continual resistance at Asahiyama-jo Castle and other places, and consequently the Shonai district was incorporated within the territory of Kagekatsu UESUGI.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Mogami's troops were defeated despite their continual resistance at places including Asahiyama-jo Castle; consequently, the Shonai district was incorporated into the territory of Kagekatsu UESUGI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 繁長は余勢を駆ってさらに兵を進めたが、東根で最上勢の猛反撃に遭い撤退した。
sen.e: Spurred by his side's victory, Shigenaga advanced his troops further, however, he was obliged to withdraw due to the fierce counteroffensive by Mogami troops.
Spurred by his side's victory, Shigenaga advanced his troops further, but he was obliged to withdraw due to a fierce counter-offensive by the Mogami troops.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Shigenaga advanced his troops further as he was spurred by his side's victory, but he was obliged to withdraw due to a fierce counter-offensive by the Mogami troops at Higashine.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この戦が起きたのは、天正15年（1587年）12月の豊臣秀吉による奥羽惣無事令の発令後であり、本来この出兵は認められないはずであった。
sen.e: This battle broke out after the proclamation of Ou Sobujirei (a cease-fire edict for Ou region) issued by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1587, therefore, dispatch of troops by Uesugi and its allies was properly not acceptable.
This battle broke out after the proclamation of Ou Sobujirei (a cease-fire edict for the Ou region) issued by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1587; thus the allied dispatch of troops by Uesugi was unlawful.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The battle broke out after the proclamation of a cease-fire edict for the Ou region issued by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in December 1587 and January 1588; which means that the allied dispatch of the troops by Uesugi should have been unlawful.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ところが秀吉は武藤義勝の庄内復帰を黙認した。
sen.e: However, Hideyoshi overlooked Yoshikatsu MUTO's reinstatement as a ruler of the Shonai district.
However, Hideyoshi overlooked Yoshikatsu MUTO's reinstatement as a ruler of the Shonai district.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: But Yoshikatsu MUTO's reinstatement as a ruler of the Shonai district was overlooked by Hideyoshi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: さらに、天正19年（1591年）に義勝が改易された後、庄内を与えられたのは上杉景勝であった。
sen.e: Moreover, it was Kagekatsu UESUGI who was given the Shonai district after Yoshikatsu was punished by being deprived of his fief in 1591.
Moreover, Kagekatsu UESUGI was given the Shonai district after Yoshikatsu was punished by being deprived of his fiefin 1591.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: When Yoshikatsu was punished by being deprived of his fief the Shonai district in 1591, the district was given to Kagekatsu UESUGI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この裁定と秀次事件における駒姫の死とが重なって、最上義光は秀吉や上杉氏に対して深い憎悪の念を抱いた。
sen.e: Yoshiaki MOGAMI, who was furious at these decisions handed down by Hideyoshi, had a deep hatred for Hideyoshi and the Uesugi clan because he was also grievously shocked by the death of his daughter Komahime (a concubine of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI) who was executed in Hidetsugu Incident by Hideyoshi's directions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshiaki MOGAMI, who was infuriated by the decisions handed down by Hideyoshi, had a deep hatred for Hideyoshi and the Uesugi clan because he was also grievously shocked by the death of his daughter Komahime (a concubine of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI), who had been executed in Hidetsugu Incident as instructed by Hideyoshi.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Yoshiaki MOGAMI had a deep hatred for Hideyoshi and the Uesugi clan, becauase he was infuriated by the decisions made by Hideyoshi and because he was grievously shocked by the death of his daughter Komahime, who was a concubine of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI and, as instructed by Hideyoshi, executed in the Hidetsugu Incident.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いで徳川家康に味方する原因となった。
sen.e: Therefore, Yoshiaki MOGAMI took sides with Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the Battle of Sekigahara.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Yoshiaki MOGAMI sided with Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the Battle of Sekigahara.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Therefore, Yoshiaki MOGAMI sided with Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the Battle of Sekigahara.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 最上義光が上杉から庄内を奪還するのは、慶長6年（1601年）4月のことであった。
sen.e: Yoshiaki MOGAMI could win back the Shonai district from Uesugi in 1601.
Yoshiaki MOGAMI won back the Shonai district from Uesugi in 1601.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Yoshiaki MOGAMI won back the Shonai district from Uesugi in May and June 1601.
sen.cmt: グレゴリ歴に修正
